SENT.plain: A 41-year-old male patient presented with veiled vision which had appeared only a few hours previously
Funduscopy revealed a retinal edema due to venous stasis retinopathy
A previous history was unknown except for an uncorrected arterial hypertension
A retinal vein thrombosis and macula edema developed in the affected eye
An antiphospholipid antibody syndrome was diagnosed which was treated with anticoagulants
